meanings.definition: Showing unusually early development or maturity
meanings.sent1: The precociously talented child amazed everyone with her advanced skills.
meanings.sent2: The little girl's precociously mature behavior surprised her parents.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was precociously good at fetching the ball, much to the amusement of the family.
meanings.sent4: The plant grew precociously fast, reaching full bloom in just a few days.
meanings.sent5: The precociously intelligent student aced the test without any difficulty.

meanings.definition: In a precocious manner, exhibiting advanced abilities or understanding at an early age
meanings.sent1: She precociously solved the puzzle before anyone else could even start.
meanings.sent2: The young artist painted precociously, capturing the essence of the scene effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat precociously opened the door by jumping on the handle, causing a moment of surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose precociously early, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The musician played the instrument precociously well, leaving the audience in awe.
